Plot#2

Something a bit more pungent and strong? #1 seems a bit too much like any IF.

Perhaps just a quest for fucking every character in the story? That, however, sounds a bit too much like a porn IF instead. It seems to lack the ridiculous* power from the raspberry reich.

What's the point of this, though? What exactly do I want to say? Or, if I don't want it say anything precisely, why am I doing it?

upon watching the raspberry reich, i was very taken by the idea of homosexual/queer revolution. Not in the real sense of it (I.e., armed revolution trying to overthrow a government or anything like that) but in the sense that, in a patriarchal society such as ours, no matter how assimilated we get, there's still a spark of non-conformity in our existence as queers.

On plot #1, I seem to have copied la bruce, simply and solely. It has been done, it has had its effect and I doubt I could make it stronger.

Plots

  1. A queer revolution slogan contest (da fuck?)
  2. quest for finding the person you can show your genitals to
  3. have X amount of actions to become as gay as possible

Ideas Actions may decrease or increase homo acting levels Orgonon Mage/saint Game may end if player acts too straight Become Orgonon saint === auto win

All in all, there's still a certain emptiness to all these ideas. Like, perhaps funny (if a bit trite) concepts, with no real meat to them. It bears to ask again, what is the goal here?

  1. Celebrate queerness in its non conformist glory?
  2. Question current queer conservatism?

Perhaps the aim should be lower, simpler. Those two questions are rather big, and I'm tackling a medium that I'm not completely familiar with. Or, I guess, their dimensions (their “bigness” if you will) depends on how I approach it. Also not irrelevant is the balance between narrative and game in IFs.
